results.title: Perindopril, atenolol, and amlodipine prevent aortic ultrastructural changes in rats exposed to ethanol.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@Perindopril@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ at high doses, but not low doses, produced some significant beneficial effects on @CHEMICAL_Alcohols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000438 @@@alcohol@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Anterior_Wall_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056988 @@@aortic wall damage@@@.

citations.NLM: Yokusoglu M, Sag C, Cincik M, Uzun M, Kayir H, Koz C, Baykal B, Ozkan M, Ozogul C, Baysan O, Uzbay IT. Perindopril, atenolol, and amlodipine prevent aortic ultrastructural changes in rats exposed to ethanol. Med Sci Monit. 2008 May;14(5):BR96-102. PMID: 18443544
citations.BibTeX: @article{18443544, title={Perindopril, atenolol, and amlodipine prevent aortic ultrastructural changes in rats exposed to ethanol.}, author={Yokusoglu M and Sag C and Cincik M and Uzun M and Kayir H and Koz C and Baykal B and Ozkan M and Ozogul C and Baysan O and Uzbay IT}, journal={Med Sci Monit}, volume={14}, number={5}, pages={BR96-102}}

results.title: Effects of early use of atenolol or captopril on infarct size and ventricular volume: A double-blind comparison in patients with anterior acute myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: In a randomized, double-blind comparison between early treatment with @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in 121 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with acute @<m>DISEASE_Anterior_Wall_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056988 @@@anterior MI@@@, both drugs showed a similar reduction in mean blood pressure.

citations.NLM: Galcerá-Tomás J, Castillo-Soria FJ, Villegas-García MM, Florenciano-Sánchez R, Sánchez-Villanueva JG, de La Rosa JA, Martínez-Caballero A, Valentí-Aldeguer JA, Jara-Pérez P, Párraga-Ramírez M, López-Martínez I, Iñigo-García L, Picó-Aracil F. Effects of early use of atenolol or captopril on infarct size and ventricular volume: A double-blind comparison in patients with anterior acute myocardial infarction. Circulation. 2001 Feb 13;103(6):813-9. PMID: 11171788
citations.BibTeX: @article{11171788, title={Effects of early use of atenolol or captopril on infarct size and ventricular volume: A double-blind comparison in patients with anterior acute myocardial infarction.}, author={Galcerá-Tomás J and Castillo-Soria FJ and Villegas-García MM and Florenciano-Sánchez R and Sánchez-Villanueva JG and de La Rosa JA and Martínez-Caballero A and Valentí-Aldeguer JA and Jara-Pérez P and Párraga-Ramírez M and López-Martínez I and Iñigo-García L and Picó-Aracil F}, journal={Circulation}, volume={103}, number={6}, pages={813-9}}

results.title: Dissociation between regional myocardial dysfunction and subendocardial ST segment elevation during and after exercise-induced ischemia in dogs.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Anterior_Wall_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056988 @@@Systolic wall dysfunction@@@ during exercise was significantly less after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and function returned toward preexercise values by 1 minute after exercise, even more rapidly than ST segment resolution.

citations.NLM: Grover-McKay M, Matsuzaki M, Ross J Jr. Dissociation between regional myocardial dysfunction and subendocardial ST segment elevation during and after exercise-induced ischemia in dogs. J Am Coll Cardiol. 1987 Nov;10(5):1105-12. PMID: 2959710
citations.BibTeX: @article{2959710, title={Dissociation between regional myocardial dysfunction and subendocardial ST segment elevation during and after exercise-induced ischemia in dogs.}, author={Grover-McKay M and Matsuzaki M and Ross J Jr}, journal={J Am Coll Cardiol}, volume={10}, number={5}, pages={1105-12}}
